caption: Absolutely a place worth visiting, the food is good and fresh, the rates are affordable and it is consistently well kept in here. Keep up the good work.
Delicious and authentic Japanese food.
One of my main spots to grab something to eat. great location, neat, and fantastic customer service. I highly recommend them!

This site is my preferable place.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this place. when  I feel like having a good supper, this restaurant comes straightaway to my head. extremely good and all sorts of  food and a large list of dishes.great crew, and agreeable ambience. Also, the tariff is modest. I tell about this place with pleasure.

For anyone who loves no frills, traditional Japanese food for a reasonable price this is the spot. The couple who own this place are also so lovely. The Japanese cuisine landscape in Boston is pretty bare (generally limited to sushi and overpriced katsu), but this cafe is quality eats and gives you all the nostalgia of home cooked meals.

This may be my most favorite Japanese food I've had in a long time. Their seaweed salad was perfect and not overly sweet, the tappenyaki was perfect. Their karage chicken was perfectly crisp, not greasy or over breaded, and their salad dressing is homemade and amazing. I cannot say enough good things about this place. The owners are so sweet and very kind. So clean too! I will be back!!

One of the tiniest and one of the best eateries in this Porter Square landmark building.  We've dined at every one of the restaurants here and Tampopo may be the best of the many excellent options.  The menu seems too big for such a tiny place but we've tried many different things here and have yet to have a bad meal. Japanese food is often expensive but prices here are reasonable,  particularly in in light of the consistently high quality and good portions.  This summer they set up some tables on the shaded arcade outside the building's rear entrance which provide a relaxing dining experience.
(Translated by Google) It is very tasty. Cheap and fast.  (Original) とても美味しいです。安くて早い。

The authenticity of the food makes me 😭😭😭... Definitely the go-to place for Japanese home dishes in Boston!! Everything on the menu is so tasteful! Don’t think I can find tender chicken tempura elsewhere in Boston!! It’s NOT cash only any more - they accept all cards and contactless payment, plus Venmo!!
The best place for udon I've had in Boston!
Absolutely delicious in a cute location. 100% Recommended. We ordered the Chicken Cutlet Curry and the Curry Risotto.

Tampopo is a small restaurant where all the food makes you feel warm and at home. The staff are all very friendly and have been working there for as long as I've been going there, probably a lot longer. They have a great variety of food and many vegetarian options. Not to mention it's very inexpensive. If you ever have a chance to visit the Lesley mall in Porter Square, go visit them, you won't be disappointed!
Best Katsu in Massachusetts!
Best Japanese restaurant I've ever had. Wonderful service and amazing food
Their fried oysters are so JUICY and TENDER! Also love their pork don.

A rather short trek from my last place of occurence before arriving at my sanctuary. This facility has brought me nothing short of bliss. Of course, this establishment has been nothing but trustworthy over the years, and I would have gone to no other place to remedy for the crimes against humanity carried out by 8d room escape.
The shop is a hidden gem located in a shopping center. Mom and pop shop and the food is genuinely delicious and cheap! I had the katsudon and two pieces of fried oyster. 10/10 would reccomend!!!

Small place in Cambridge with great flavor. We had a Sukiyaki bowl, which was very full filling and tasteful, and a pork cutlet, that was very crispy outside and tender inside. Will definitely come again...
Any time I eat chicken karaage elsewhere, I'm disappointed that it's not as good.
I like this place a lot. It has a special mood. The cuisine is superb. the service is efficient and the personel is courteous. The pay is decent. I highly recommend.

I know it's a mom and pop store and I should not give them a negative or average review...but I have to put it out there that their customer service is great, very sweet couple. But If you have been to Japan and you know that curries are far better and different than what you find here. Probably because of lack of great Japanese options in the greater Boston and being close to college area, this has earned its loyal fan base...but I would not go for food here. Actually better option is to go eat at yume ga arukara just next to it where the wait is worth it.
Delicious! My favorite spot in the dining hall outside of Yume. Get the curry pork Katsu with vegetable and egg over rice

This is very a great Japanese restaurant hiding amidst the food court here. The tempura's here are supposed to be great! really enjoyed the teriyaki chicken bowl and the miso soup. Do try the fried oyster!
Always friendly, prompt service and Japanese staples that are simple and delicious. The udon is perfect for a rainy day!

The most authentic Japanese family-run eatery in the whole mall (possibly the whole Boston) and their katsudon, eggplant dishes, and udon noodle taste just like the food in the top-rated restaurants outside my house in Tokyo!! Most authentic Japanese food is on the heavier side contrary to common belief, but so delicious!!!

It is a hidden gem in Porter Square. Authentic Japanese menu with creative twists. Chef seeks great balance with ingredients and flavors. Deep fried things are not that oily as he cares about the level of freshness of the oil. Try Tampopo's Tempura or their home made croquettes. Chicken Karage is also reasonably priced and delicious. Much better than some over-rated ramens.

Yasu is a wonderful chef, & his staff are accommodating & friendly. Everything I've had here has been lovely, especially the takoyaki, which I recommend to anyone who hasn't tried it. It's an indulgent, savory treat!

We go here almost every week recently but are loyal customers since Early 2005. They have limited gluten free options for celiac people, but if they have ingredients and you kinda know what you want? they can make. I've seen people try to say this is chinese food, order terryaki chicken, and complain of cash only. The waiting staff AND cooking staff are the nicest people you will ever meet, in your life, it shows in the food, heaven in a bowl. I get the croquet or chicken tampopo but octopus and curry are simply the tastiest dishes ever. Yum.  If you wanna be told "good job" for eating your ownfood and being lined up like cattle, go to the udon soup next door.

What a hidden gem in this already spectacular food court. Short wait times and katsudon that’s to die for. House-made iced tea was delicious. And extremely affordable. Was sat and finished our meal before the line next door could reset. Coming back again this week!
Pork katsu dishes and gyoza app are very good and reasonably priced! Cash only, just for reference.

Fast service at a good price (for Cambridge prices). The serving size was generous, the Teriyaki meal included lot of meat over nicely cooked rice. The sauce was a bit heavy and oily but it tasted very rich and savory. The restaurant itself was a small spot in a row of restaurants styled like an indoor street market. It was fairly busy and lively.
Wow the prices are crazy good. Where else can you get miso soup for a dollar?? Meals are also yummy. Staff was friendly and accommodating.
I've been going to tampopon for nearly 15 years. It's my little piece of Tokyo in Cambridge. Love the pork curry

I suggest tampopo don pork, the seaweed and sauce was spectacular. Since I go here often, I decided to order our. Unfortunately, they didn't cook my meat enough for my cuts/strips, some were barely cooked or raw. I just hope they fix that mistake.
Excellent!! My favorite is the Tampopo Don (pork) but everything is good. Don't miss the house iced tea.
Agemono. The curry here is the best by far.
It really good, small but just enough space to enjoy the food. I love the shrimp tampura and it was totally worth the wait!!
Ok Curry.
Friendly workers, and awesome foods!!
Cool, hidden Japanese place. Very authentic and affordable. Few seats, so you might have to wait as this place is popular.
Great cash only spot for delicious Donburi at very reasonable prices.
Whenever I go, I eat wonderful food. Don't be scared of its small size, the food is delicious and staff friendly!
I'm coming here every time for the chicken katsudon. Not having katsudon in years and this place was very 懐かしい

I literally don’t understand the reviews for this place....the staff is very friendly but the food was NOT good. My boyfriend and I legit paid, and left all the food there. We got the gyoza which was fully deep fried, not too bad. But we also got the curry pork katsu. The fried pork katsu was lacking salt! And the curry sauce was horrible. Legit tasted like SEMI flavored water. Needed tons of seasoning, bland AF! Needed salt, flavor, spice, everything. I decided to come here based on the reviews and was taken back at how far off they were. You can find much much better curry katsu in the Boston area.
Most authentic katsu and tempura donburi I’ve had outside of Japan

I didn't give one star because the effort is there.  The tempura was properly made although there were black dots throughout (no not cracked pepper, it's the burnt batter).  The issue was the rice.  Both our bowls had rice that was cooked with too much water, as such the rice became gluey, we didn't come for congee.  At the end of the dinner, my Wife's curry rice bowl was filled with water in the bottom, the curry was less than flavourful, and just can't be finished.  At least we can say we tried.

Best Japanese restaurant in Porter, and best Japanese restaurant in the Boston area. They have a wide selection of Japanese comfort foods that satisfy whatever craving you have. The staff speaks Japanese which is nice, and helps reiterate that the cooks know what they are doing. My favorite is any curry and the sukiyaki beef. Their lunch special is also a great deal.

I wasn't aware this place was such a small little place tucked into a mall, but I was very impressed by the food (had chicken curry) and the price and service is very good. Just be aware, cash only and there's very limited seating.

It was very busy because a comic book event was happening in the mall, but even though the wait was long we managed to get a seat and order food. To my surprise and delight there were several gluten free options and the waitstaff was attentive and helpful with my diatary needs. And I asked for a salad as my side, but since the salad dressing wasn't gluten free they put together a simple gluten free dressing using gf soy sauce for me. I ordered the steamed tofu and vegetables over rice. The sauce they used was pretty good, and the tofu was silken and smooth. The reason why I am not giving 5 stars is because even after being seated we waited a very long time before they took our order, and people seated after us got served before we even got to order. Also my boifriend was given the wrong meal (ordered a curry bowl and an extra egg and was given a fried tofu bowl instead, and they forgot the egg too).
My favorite place to get katsu or tempura
Such delicious food! The lunch specials are so good and so affordable. I wish they would expand their business. This is someone who was raised in Hawaii and adopted by a Japanese family.

One of my favourite places. It's hard to find authentic "comfort" Japanese food on the East Coast. This place is as close to the food I ate in Japan as I have found. They serve favs like tonkatsu curry and croquettes (korokke). My go-to is the Tampopodon, which has a generous portion of rice topped with a seaweed mixture and meat of choice, and their delicious spicy mayo on top. They also include a piece of broccoli and a piece of carrot, which I usually save for my "dessert" when I'm full. I get the white meat chicken with this dish, and it's always perfectly cooked.
Still the GOAT after all these years
Top tier food
Tasty Japanese food including tempura, udon and chicken kara age.
Amazing Japanese comfort food.  Get the Tampopo Don - what the restaurant is named after - and you will be coming back again and again.
Great little traditional Japanese restaurant inside Lesley College. Serves up some great Don (rice bowls) dishes as well as Udon. Reminded me of the little shops in Okinawa.
Tasty place
Great food. Amazing service. Food comes very fast and they keep it low-key.
Not bad!  Had the kara-age Curry bowl.  Might look like a small amount but it will fill you up when you finish it!

I live in California, I've been to Hawaii, and I've been to many Japanese places, but Tampopo still holds a special place in my heart. Small seating area, no-frills for sure, but extremely good. Definitely try the Katsutama, or the Sukiyaki!
Amazing. Family owned and delicious!
Exceptional quality and impressive selection of specials.  I'd never even seen monkfish liver on a menu.

We visit Tampopo for one thing, generally, and that's the excellent, homey tempura they offer. Though the batter may be less of a standard, dry-crispy style, it's the sort of dish that'll warm you right up. Seafood tempura udon was very good, with well-cooked noodles and well-cooked fish. When we go to the Porter Exchange for a meal, Tampopo is always a contender for a visit.
Good, authentic Japanese cuisine for a reasonable price.

My mouth is watering just thinking about the last time I went to this place! One of my friends suggested we meet up here (a small tempura style Japanese restaurant), and we arrived with a group of 6 unsure if we'd be seated together. However, the woman there was very nice, and specially re-arranged all of the tables and chairs so we could all be together in such a tiny space!  I ordered the Pork Tampopo Don and shared the fried Octopus balls with a friend and they were both delicious and very filling too! Some of my friends tried the chicken teriyaki and curry that I maybe I'll try next time I go.  Aside from the driving nightmare that is Porter Square, there is a private lot for parking at Lesley University with very reasonable rates if you get your ticket validated for purchase of $10+. On the weekend I think it was $1.50 for 2 hours. We had to read the fine print and run back to the restaurant to get the lady to stamp all of our parking passes.
Traditional Japanese food, American-sized servings. 10/10 definitely going again!
Two words: Soboro beef.
Very simple little place with delicious food. Quite nicely priced for how much food you get
Authentic donburi, tempura and curry
Best.
It's soon gonna be my regular dinning place :)

Delicious authentic Japanese cuisine, very limited vegan options, very reasonably priced. They make some delicious authentic Japanese food that I would highly recommend. The Buddhist curry and Dynamite bowl are very delicious.
Amazing!
Good katsu and karaage. Nice hole in the wall. Took over an hour to get food once though. Some people ordered and finished their food before our table got ours. Wish it was open later.
The waiter first threatened to move me to a smaller table if the place gets crowded even before I could sit down. It didn't, at 7pm. She then charged me 30% more than the price on the menu.
Great staff.
